alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 8:28AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern El Paso and northwestern Pueblo Counties through 900 AM MDT... At 828 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Pueblo West, or 16 miles northwest of Pueblo, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Colorado Springs, Fountain, Stratmoor, Fort Carson, Security, Security-Widefield and Pueblo West. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet
